verses.verse: Then the LORD<WH3068> answered<WH6030> Job<WH347> out of the whirlwind<WH5591>, and said<WH559>,
Who is this that darkeneth<WH2821> counsel<WH6098> by words<WH4405> without knowledge<WH1847>?
Gird up<WH247> now thy loins<WH2504> like a man<WH1397>; for I will demand<WH7592> of thee, and answer<WH3045> thou me. answer: Heb. make me know
Where<WH375> wast thou when I laid the foundations<WH3245> of the earth<WH776>? declare<WH5046>, if thou hast<WH3045> understanding<WH998>. hast: Heb. knowest understanding
Who hath laid<WH7760> the measures<WH4461> thereof, if thou knowest<WH3045>? or who hath stretched<WH5186> the line<WH6957> upon it?
Whereupon are the foundations<WH134> thereof fastened<WH2883>? or who laid<WH3384> the corner<WH6438> stone<WH68> thereof; foundations: Heb. sockets fastened: Heb. made to sink?
When the morning<WH1242> stars<WH3556> sang<WH7442> together<WH3162>, and all the sons<WH1121> of God<WH430> shouted<WH7321> for joy?
Or who shut up<WH5526> the sea<WH3220> with doors<WH1817>, when it brake forth<WH1518>, as if it had issued out<WH3318> of the womb<WH7358>?
When I made<WH7760> the cloud<WH6051> the garment<WH3830> thereof, and thick darkness<WH6205> a swaddlingband<WH2854> for it,
And brake up<WH7665> for it my decreed<WH2706> place, and set<WH7760> bars<WH1280> and doors<WH1817>, brake: or, established my decree upon it
And said<WH559>, Hitherto<WH5704> <WH6311> shalt thou come<WH935>, but no further<WH3254>: and here shall thy proud<WH1347> waves<WH1530> be stayed<WH7896>? thy: Heb. the pride of thy waves
Hast thou commanded<WH6680> the morning<WH1242> since thy days<WH3117>; and caused the dayspring<WH7837> to know<WH3045> his place<WH4725>;
That it might take hold<WH270> of the ends<WH3671> of the earth<WH776>, that the wicked<WH7563> might be shaken out<WH5287> of it? ends: Heb. wings
It is turned<WH2015> as clay<WH2563> to the seal<WH2368>; and they stand<WH3320> as a garment<WH3830>.
And from the wicked<WH7563> their light<WH216> is withholden<WH4513>, and the high<WH7311> arm<WH2220> shall be broken<WH7665>.
Hast thou entered<WH935> into the springs<WH5033> of the sea<WH3220>? or hast thou walked<WH1980> in the search<WH2714> of the depth<WH8415>?
Have the gates<WH8179> of death<WH4194> been opened<WH1540> unto thee? or hast thou seen<WH7200> the doors<WH8179> of the shadow of death<WH6757>?
Hast thou perceived<WH995> the breadth<WH7338> of the earth<WH776>? declare<WH5046> if thou knowest<WH3045> it all.
Where is the way<WH1870> where light<WH216> dwelleth<WH7931>? and as for darkness<WH2822>, where is the place<WH4725> thereof,
That thou shouldest take<WH3947> it to the bound<WH1366> thereof, and that thou shouldest know<WH995> the paths<WH5410> to the house<WH1004> thereof? to the bound: or, at, etc
Knowest<WH3045> thou it, because thou wast then born<WH3205>? or because the number<WH4557> of thy days<WH3117> is great<WH7227>?
Hast thou entered<WH935> into the treasures<WH214> of the snow<WH7950>? or hast thou seen<WH7200> the treasures<WH214> of the hail<WH1259>,
Which I have reserved<WH2820> against the time<WH6256> of trouble<WH6862>, against the day<WH3117> of battle<WH7128> and war<WH4421>?
By what<WH335> way<WH1870> is the light<WH216> parted<WH2505>, which scattereth<WH6327> the east wind<WH6921> upon the earth<WH776>?
Who hath divided<WH6385> a watercourse<WH8585> for the overflowing of waters<WH7858>, or a way<WH1870> for the lightning<WH2385> of thunder<WH6963>;
To cause it to rain<WH4305> on the earth<WH776>, where no man<WH376> is; on the wilderness<WH4057>, wherein there is no man<WH120>;
To satisfy<WH7646> the desolate<WH7722> and waste<WH4875> ground; and to cause the bud<WH4161> of the tender herb<WH1877> to spring forth<WH6779>?
Hath<WH3426> the rain<WH4306> a father<WH1>? or who hath begotten<WH3205> the drops<WH96> of dew<WH2919>?
Out of whose womb<WH990> came<WH3318> the ice<WH7140>? and the hoary frost<WH3713> of heaven<WH8064>, who hath gendered<WH3205> it?
The waters<WH4325> are hid<WH2244> as with a stone<WH68>, and the face<WH6440> of the deep<WH8415> is frozen<WH3920>. is: Heb. is taken
Canst thou bind<WH7194> the sweet influences<WH4575> of Pleiades<WH3598>, or loose<WH6605> the bands<WH4189> of Orion<WH3685>? Pleiades: or, the seven stars: Heb. Cimah Orion: Heb. Cesil?
Canst thou bring forth<WH3318> Mazzaroth<WH4216> in his season<WH6256>? or canst thou guide<WH5148> Arcturus<WH5906> with his sons<WH1121>? Mazzaroth: or, the twelve signs guide: Heb. guide them
Knowest<WH3045> thou the ordinances<WH2708> of heaven<WH8064>? canst thou set<WH7760> the dominion<WH4896> thereof in the earth<WH776>?
Canst thou lift up<WH7311> thy voice<WH6963> to the clouds<WH5645>, that abundance<WH8229> of waters<WH4325> may cover<WH3680> thee?
Canst thou send<WH7971> lightnings<WH1300>, that they may go<WH3212>, and say<WH559> unto thee, Here we are? Here: Heb. Behold us?
Who hath put<WH7896> wisdom<WH2451> in the inward parts<WH2910>? or who hath given<WH5414> understanding<WH998> to the heart<WH7907>?
Who can number<WH5608> the clouds<WH7834> in wisdom<WH2451>? or who can stay<WH7901> the bottles<WH5035> of heaven<WH8064>, stay: Heb. cause to lie down
When the dust<WH6083> groweth<WH3332> into hardness<WH4165>, and the clods<WH7263> cleave fast together<WH1692>? groweth: or, is turned into mire: Heb. is poured
Wilt thou hunt<WH6679> the prey<WH2964> for the lion<WH3833>? or fill<WH4390> the appetite<WH2416> of the young lions<WH3715>, the appetite: Heb. the life
When they couch<WH7817> in their dens<WH4585>, and abide<WH3427> in the covert<WH5521> to<WH3926> lie in wait<WH695>?
Who provideth<WH3559> for the raven<WH6158> his food<WH6718>? when his young ones<WH3206> cry<WH7768> unto God<WH410>, they wander<WH8582> for lack<WH1097> of meat<WH400>.
